section2.title: At TCO we search, identify and develop local suppliers for world-class projects like Tengiz
section2.description:
TCO operates one of the largest and technologically challenging oilfields in the world. Safety and reliability of exploration and production operations in Tengiz are the key to success in fueling Kazakhstani’s economic progress and fulfilling global energy demand.
Our mission is to source goods and services that meet international standards while enabling opportunities for local suppliers and talents.

rightWay.title: Doing it Right Way
rightWay.description:
When it comes to local content, measuring our performance is important to track our success.
Calculation and reporting of Kazakhstani content spent is one of the legal requirements for TCO. It’s in our best interests to ensure that TCO suppliers are familiar with methodology of KC calculation. On a quarterly basis we conduct relevant training for our Business Partners that cover certain aspects of Subsoil Use Code and governmental decrees, which govern the calculation of local content, basic concepts and definitions, and examples of calculating KC in goods and services spent. Please note that this training is dedicated to TCO’s current suppliers and contractors only.

devManufacture.description: TCO's internal program is to analyze upcoming purchases and search for potential suppliers together with TCO technical experts. As a result of the analysis, a list of “target goods and services” is revealed, for which we check and qualify suppliers, as well as place test orders with them. Below is a list of high potential titles including electrical services, chemical manufacturing, maintenance, repair and operation (TORE) and more. Throughout 2021, several TCO departments have developed supplier capabilities at once, supplying more than 18 products in categories such as rescue equipment, electrical equipment, drilling materials, maintenance services, telecommunications equipment, and materials for maintenance, repair and operation (MRE). ) and other telecommunications equipment, as well as materials for maintenance, repair and operation (TORE) and more.

supportOriginBusiness.title: Joint Initiative to Support and Strengthen the Capacity of Local Enterprises
supportOriginBusiness.description:
EBRD specialists help implement a consultancy project with local and international consultants, while an enterprise receives a partial refund of the costs of attracting a consultant. Trainings and workshops for local suppliers are also organised as part of the program.
Existing TCO suppliers, as well as potential suppliers who do not have direct contacts with this sector, will participate in the programme in order to increase their opportunities for cooperation with TCO and establishing supplies for the needs of the oil and gas sector in Kazakhstan.

offerEnterprise.title: What we offer to enterprises
offerEnterprise.subtitle: Better access to know-how
offerEnterprise.description:
Consulting services for business provide enterprises high growth potential, the opportunity to get the help of local consultants and / or international experts, while workshops and trainings help to improve knowledge in various fields, such as strategy, operational management and quality control, finance and audit.
In addition, companies that offer goods and / or services for the oil and gas industry work with local and international consultants on the basis of a joint cost- sharing arrangement with the EBRD (the Bank reimburses up to 75% of the project cost) in order to improve the productivity of enterprises in various areas of their activities.
offerEnterprise.footerText: The program aims to improve the access of enterprises to the financial resources necessary for growth and development.

benefits.title: On exemption from value added tax for Kazakh producers
benefits.subtitle: On exemption from value added tax for Kazakh producers
descriptions: We bring to your attention that, in accordance with the provisions of paragraph 1 of Article 393 of the Tax Code of the Republic of Kazakhstan “On taxes and other obligatory payments to the budget” (as amended and supplemented as of 04/01/2021, hereinafter referred to as the Tax Code), is taxed on value added at zero rate Turnover from the sale of goods of own production to taxpayers operating in the territory of the Republic of Kazakhstan under a subsoil use contract, production sharing agreement (contract), in accordance with the terms of which imported goods are exempt from value added tax.

Tengizchevroil LLP (hereinafter referred to as TCO) is included in the List of taxpayers operating in the territory of the Republic of Kazakhstan under a subsoil use contract, a production sharing agreement (contract), in accordance with the terms of which imported goods are exempt from value added tax, approved by order and about. Minister of Energy of the Republic of Kazakhstan dated February 28, 2018 No. 71.

The requirements for documents confirming such a sale of goods at a zero VAT rate are specified in paragraph 4 of Article 393 of the Tax Code. We also draw your attention to the need to confirm the country of production of goods with the relevant certificates of origin for such goods produced in the Republic of Kazakhstan.
TCO welcomes government support for local manufacturers to maintain competitiveness with foreign manufacturers.
